subject: linear_algebra
title: Solving Systems of Linear Equations: Particular and Homogeneous Solutions
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll demonstrate how to find particular and homogeneous solutions in a system of linear equations.

problem.statementHtml:
Find the solution set for the system:

  • 2x + 3y = 5
  • x - 2y = -1
hints: Hint: Start by solving one equation for one variable
problem.solutionHtml:
We'll use the first equation to solve for x:

  • 2x + 3y = 5
  • x = (5-3y)/2

workedExample.problemHtml:
Find the particular and homogeneous solutions for the system:

  • 2x + 3y = 5
  • x - 2y = -1

steps.description: Solve one equation for one variable
steps.explanation: This allows us to express x in terms of y

steps.description: Substitute the expression into the other equation
steps.explanation: Now we have an equation with only one variable, y

steps.description: Solve for y and then find x
steps.explanation: We can now substitute the value of y into the expression we found earlier to get the value of x

steps.description: Write the solution in parametric form
steps.explanation: This shows that every point on the line is a solution to the system

intuition: The key insight here is that we can use one equation to solve for one variable and then substitute that expression into the other equation.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Solving Systems of Linear Equations: Solution Sets
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll demonstrate how to find particular and homogeneous solutions in a system of linear equations.

problem.statementHtml:
Find the solution set for the following system:

  • 2x + y - z = 1
  • x - 3y + 2z = -2
  • y + z = 0
hints: Start by solving for one variable
problem.solutionHtml: To find the solution set, we'll use elimination to solve for y and then express x in terms of y.

workedExample.problemHtml:
Find the particular and homogeneous solutions for the system:

  • x + 2y - z = 3
  • 2x - y + 3z = 5
  • y + 2z = -1

steps.description: Add the first two equations to eliminate y
steps.explanation: This eliminates y and gives us a new equation in terms of x and z.

steps.description: Subtract three times the third equation from the result
steps.explanation: This further simplifies the equation and helps us solve for x.

steps.description: Solve for x in terms of z
steps.explanation: Now we have a parametric form for the solution set.

workedExample.finalAnswer: The particular and homogeneous solutions are...

intuition: Notice how elimination helps us reduce the system to a smaller, more manageable size.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Solving Systems of Linear Equations: Particular and Homogeneous Solutions
contentHtml: In this example, we'll explore how to find particular and homogeneous solutions in a system of linear equations.
problemHtml:
Find the general solution for the system:
\[\begin{align*} x + 2y - z &= 1 \\ 3x - y + 4z &= 0 \end{align*}\]",
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Write down the augmented matrix", "mathHtml": "\\[\\left| \\begin{array}{ccc} 1 & 2 &-1 \\\\ 3 &-1 & 4 \\end{array} \\right| \\begin{array}{c} 1 \\\\ 0 \\end{array}\]", "explanation": "This helps us see the structure of the system."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Row-reduce the augmented matrix", "mathHtml": "\\[\\left| \\begin{array}{ccc} 1 & 2 &-1 \\\\ 0 & -5 & 7 \\end{array} \\right| \\begin{array}{c} 1 \\\\ 0 \\end{array}\]", "explanation": "This simplifies the system and helps us identify free variables."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Find the particular solution", "mathHtml": "\\[x = -\\frac{7}{5}, y = 0, z = 1\]", "explanation": "Now we can plug in these values to find a specific solution."}, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Write down the homogeneous system", "mathHtml": "\\[\\begin{align*} x + 2y - z &= 0 \\ 3x - y + 4z &= 0 \end{align*}\]", "explanation": "This is the same system without the constant terms."}, {"stepNumber": 5, "description": "Solve the homogeneous system", "mathHtml": "\\[\\begin{align*} x + 2y - z &= 0 \\ 3x - y + 4z &= 0 \end{align*}\]", "explanation": "We can use row-reduction again to find the general solution."} ],
finalAnswer: The general solution is x = t, y = \\frac{2}{5}t, z = -\\frac{7}{5}t" },
intuition: Particular and homogeneous solutions are crucial in linear algebra. Understanding how to find them helps you solve systems of equations efficiently.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Solving Systems of Linear Equations: Solution Sets
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll demonstrate how to solve a system of linear equations using particular and homogeneous solutions.

problem.statementHtml:
Solve the following system of linear equations:

  • 2x + y - z = 1
  • x - 2y + 3z = -2
  • 3x + 2y + z = 4
hints: Start by finding the free variables
problem.solutionHtml: To solve this system, we'll first find the particular solution. Then, we'll find the homogeneous solution.

workedExample.problemHtml:
Solve the following system of linear equations:

  • 2x + y - z = 1
  • x - 2y + 3z = -2
  • 3x + 2y + z = 4

steps.explanation: This is done to find the specific values of x, y, and z.
This is used to find the general form of the solution.
By combining these two solutions, we get the final answer.

intuition: Understanding how to solve systems of linear equations is crucial in many applications, including machine learning and artificial intelligence.
